description: The Countess maintains a small stable of elegantly adorned gargon mounts for her sole use. Many a rival has been taken in by the finery to their peril as she personally oversees their deadly training.

name: Battle Gargon Silessa
description: Silessa fought valiantly alongside her master in the great incursion by the Light, following the battle her master set her to guard over a vault room of great value.

name: Gravestone Battle Gargon
description: Representative of a new loyal batch of gargon, these battle ready beasts will take Renathal's most loyal compatriots into the final battles against the Jailer.

name: Hopecrusher Gargon
description: Once the loyal mount of a House Briarbane lord, it turned on the lord and his retinue. Members of House Briarbane now whisper of a dark Gargon lying in wait even baiting venthyr who venture through the darker parts of the Chalice District of Revendreth.

name: Inquisition Gargon
description: The gargon of the Inquisitors are some of the most vicious ever carved. The Avowed seek to recapture these beasts and return them to the righteous duty of assisting in the purifying of souls rather than the perversions performed at the hands of the Inquisitors.

name: Sinfall Gargon
description: The gargon are the loyal mounts and companions of the Venthyr and Renathal has found many abandoned at Sinfall, awaiting reawakening and assignment to worthy members of the covenant.

name: Crypt Gargon
description: Loyal hounds of the Curator, these gargon patrol the crypts and catacombs deterring both trespassing and escape.

name: Umbral Scythehorn
description: Umbral gorm are the most docile of all gorm, but they also grow the largest horns and mandibles. They are probably so docile because other creatures avoid riling them.

name: Wild Hunt Legsplitter
description: Integrated into the depleted forces of the Wild Hunt, the fawn riders quickly found that the gorm's powerful mandibles were perfect for cutting down close enemy ranks.

name: Darkwarren Hardshell
description: The Darkwarren Hardshell's chitin is sturdy enough to withstand mortar shells and dragon's fire. It will also conviently consume anything lacking anima, if needed.

name: Pale Acidmaw
description: The acid present in the ichor of this creature sapped away the color from its shell, leaving it a striking shade of snowy white.

name: Spinemaw Gladechewer
description: Spriggan riders tie bits of anima-less detritus to the end of sticks in front of their gorm mounts to steer. It's... an imperfect art.

name: Voracious Gorger
description: The devourers are presumed to have their origins in the In-Between, a space between the lands of the Shadowlands that few have explored.

name: Endmire Flyer
description: Attracted through portals through which little is known these flying devourers have found a home in the Endmire of Revendreth feeding on the latent anima.

name: Chittering Animite
description: These exceptionally agile fliers make excellent mounts once they've been trained not to sap every ounce of anima from their rider.

name: Tamed Mauler
description: When it comes to taming devourers, all it takes is a little anima and a lot of patience. And a lot of healing potions.

name: Rampaging Mauler
description: One would think controlling a rampaging mount would be difficult, but if you can learn to control the direction of the rampage it can be quite useful.

name: Slayer's Felbroken Shrieker
description: You broke it, you bought it.

name: Felsaber
description: A special creation of Lord Illidan gifted to his most trusted demon hunters.

name: Shu-Zen, the Divine Sentinel
description: As the Golden Lotus worked tirelessly to repair the Vale of Eternal Blossoms, a single statue came to life and wordlessly defended them from the Sha that assaulted them. Believed by some to be a sign of good fortune and others to be a gift from the Light, Shu-Zen provides faithful companionship to any that would defend Azeroth from the maddening whispers of the Old Gods.

name: Heart of the Aspects
description: You are Azeroth's true guardians and the future of this world is in your hands, for the dawning of the age of mortals has begun. - Alexstrasza

name: Vengeance
description: Sylvanas lost a part of herself the day Arthas took her life, and the darkness within her grew to fill the void.

name: Drake of the Four Winds
description: Rocks erode, fires sputter, but wind remains powerful regardless of the passage of time. -Phaoris

name: Crimson Gladiator's Drake
description: Forged in the fires of conquest, and armored to the teeth.

name: Seabraid Stallion
description: Horses in the Kul Tiran military are bred from an early age not to fear the sea, and revel in galloping along the shoreline and through the spray.

name: Dawnforge Ram
description: A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.

name: Darkforge Ram
description: A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.

name: Duskwing Ohuna
description: If you look to the night sky and see the clouds whisk by don't panic. It may just be the illusive Duskwing Ohuna.

name: Zenet Hatchling
description: The hardest winds begin with a gust and a flap.

name: Divine Kiss of Ohn'ahra
description: ...as though welcomed by the wind itself.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Hogrus, Swine of Good Fortune
description: Hogrus was first seen by Emperor Shaohao on the third day of his meditation, and is considered by the Pandaren to be a sign of good fortune to come to those who take action.

name: Alabaster Stormtalon
description: Chiseled by the stonemasons of Stormwind, this stone gryphon symbolizes the unbending courage of the Alliance.

name: Alabaster Thunderwing
description: Chiseled by the stoneworkers of Orgrimmar, this stone wind rider is a symbol of the unwavering strength of the Horde.

name: Explorer's Jungle Hopper
description: For when you're making a crash landing in the middle of an uncharted swamp because it's the only way to access that ancient temple.

name: Ny'alotha Allseer
description: To find him, drown yourself in the Circle of Stars.

name: Enchanted Fey Dragon
description: This majestic creature is Brightwing's older brother. He affirms that she was, in fact, adopted.

name: Predatory Bloodgazer
description: The sheer amount of raw red berries these fierce omnivors consume gives them their distinctive eye color.

name: Viridian Sharptalon
description: Adept at blending into dense, magical forests, such as one may find around the Broken Isles.

name: Brilliant Direbeak
description: The shimmering hides of these deceptively fierce and coordinated beasts is intended to confuse and disorient prey.

name: Snowfeather Hunter
description: Capable of hiding in a fog bank until prey approaches, then slicing them open with one claw-raised jump.

name: Undercity Plaguebat
description: One of the last of the giant bats to escape Undercity following the siege of Lordaeron.

name: Corrupted Dreadwing
description: Bathed in the blood of demons, these corrupted Dread Ravens are significantly more aggressive, and will often kill one another if kept in confinement.

name: Antoran Charhound
description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

name: Antoran Gloomhound
description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

name: Primal Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Warmongering Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Wild Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Illidari Felstalker
description: The Illidari have broken some lesser demons for use against their Legion masters.

name: Primal Flamesaber
description: The primal landscape of Azeroth was once swarming with elemental creatures of all types.

name: Fathom Dweller
description: Deep within the hungering chasms of the Great Sea, swarms of Fathom Dwellers sway like a great floating carpet, sightlessly in the dark.

name: Brinedeep Bottom-Feeder
description: These elusive fish prefer to skulk in the deepest reaches of the Great Sea, searching the darkness for food.

name: Lord of the Corpseflies
description: To be the Lord of the Corpseflies, you've got to lay a LOT of eggs.

name: Battlefield Swarmer
description: Corpseflies are strongly attracted to the smell of dead bodies and will swarm an active battlefield as soon as the first corpse falls.

name: Maldraxxian Corpsefly
description: Corpseflies were once found throughout Maldraxxus, but many died out in the absence of anima. With anima flowing once again, they swarm.

name: Regal Corpsefly
description: Only the forces of Maldraxxus would call a corpsefly "regal."

name: Wild Glimmerfur Prowler
description: This prowler's brilliant green coat distinguishes it from the blues and purples of Ardenweald, making it much easier for others of its kind to see through the midnight woods.

name: Liberated Slyvern
description: It's difficult to tell because it's far too angry, but this slyvern is actually glad it's not owned by gnolls anymore.

name: Temperamental Skyclaw
description: Slyverns are rarely comfortable acting as mounts. Only those willing to feed their gluttonous appetites and keep a careful eye on them should attempt to ride.

name: Frostwolf Snarler
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan, trained to bite dwarves.

name: Mastercraft Gravewing
description: Handcrafted by the Stonewright herself, this mastefully crafted stoneborn is entrusted only to those she deems worthy.

name: Obsidian Gravewing
description: In the darkened skies of Revendreth, you cannot see these creatures coming until it is too late.

name: Sinfall Gravewing
description: With anima once again flowing in Sinfall, the Stonewright has been able to infuse these Stoneborn, making them valuable allies in the battles to come.

name: Pale Gravewing
description: Gravewings know no fear and are nearly indestructible -- perfect for an assault on the Maw.

name: Ghastly Charger
description: Not all of Medivh's victims are gone for good.

name: Bonehoof Tauralus
description: There are quite a few reasons that you do not want to stand behind a tauralus, the hooves and whip-like tails being the least of them.

name: Armored Bonehoof Tauralus
description: A favored mount of the House of the Chosen, the tauralus only gets more angry and vicious when exposed to battle.

name: Armored War-Bred Tauralus
description: The tauralus that serve the armies of Maldraxxus have had all traits of compassion bred out of them, and are only adorned in armor when they show that no sword or spell can stop them from carrying their rider to victory.

name: Armored Plaguerot Tauralus
description: When fully armored, a tauralus can take an incredible amount of damage before falling, making it a valuable ally in battle.

name: Armored Chosen Tauralus
description: The tauralus has two tails, which are both absolutely necessary for whipping away buzzing pests like the bloodlouse.

name: War-Bred Tauralus
description: The soldiers of Maldraxxus protect the Shadowlands, and require a mount that is both capable and calm when faced with overwhelming odds.

name: Plaguerot Tauralus
description: The tauralus is considered courageous, though scholars of Maldraxxus have long wondered if their lack of fear is simply due to the tiny size of their brains.

name: Chosen Tauralus
description: Even an unarmored tauralus is a valuable ally in battle, its enormous horns capable of piercing even plate armor.

name: Wild Goretusk
description: If you want a gentle ride, go find a "tame happytusk" or something.

name: Domesticated Razorback
description: "Domesticated" does not mean "friendly." Bring some treats.

name: Giant Coldsnout
description: Its snout is not just cold but wet. Not a pleasant way to wake up.

name: Great Greytusk
description: Sheds its tusks once a year. Is extremely shy until they grow back.

name: Trained Rocktusk
description: Thoroughly trained in how to snort, trot, and stomp on the faces of its enemies.

name: Bristling Hellboar
description: The one and only source for the rare culinary ingredient: cursed bacon.

name: Blacksteel Battleboar
description: Refuses to run unless its head is covered in heavy, spiked metal. It's an ego thing.

name: Rocktusk Battleboar
description: It's not the metal helmet that attracts mates; it's the sweet mohawk.

name: Armored Frostboar
description: Subsists almost entirely on a diet of frozen berries. Though it finds slow off-worlders equally tasty.

name: Armored Razorback
description: Never... ever... EVER... let it smell bacon on you.

name: Frostplains Battleboar
description: If it didn't have the cool tusk ring, it would feel so silly in that outfit.

name: Horrid Dredwing
description: Harika the Horrid terrorized the denizens of the Forest Ward, and with her demise her broodlings can now take this horror to denizens farther afield.

name: Harvester's Dredwing
description: The dredwings of the Harvesters fear no mawsworn, and will gleefully sink their teeth into anything that threatens Sinfall.

name: Silvertip Dredwing
description: Bred by the Revendreth prince, Renathal, these rare dredwing are fiercely loyal and will only let those deemed worthy by the prince himself to interact with them.

name: Rampart Screecher
description: Roosting among the ramparts of Castle Nathria, these giant dredbats act as sentinels and are trained to take down threats approaching the castle from the air.

name: Rocket Shredder 9001
description: The salesgoblin always tells people about the RS-9001's huge variety of attachments, but somehow neglects to mention that you never get to pick the attachments it'll have when you mount up.

name: Pattie
description: Preservationist Kathos encountered Pattie on her first assignment to Vol'dun. Pattie developed an affinity to Preservationist work but is eager to delve deeper, helping adventurers in their sleuthing.

name: Solar Spirehawk
description: Looking into the eyes of this mystical beast is like peering into the heart of the sun. Goggles are recommended when you're riding.

name: Trained Riverwallow
description: Riverwallows are one of the heartiest beasts on Draenor, resulting in their increased stamina and distinctive coloring.

name: Sapphire Riverbeast
description: This animal's color mimics the clear blue of Draenor's river shallows, making it almost invisible to aquatic predators.

name: Mudback Riverbeast
description: Special webbing that grows on the soles of the mudback's feet gives them extra traction in mud and slick terrain.

name: Mosshide Riverwallow
description: Aggressive and territorial, the mosshide is known for hiding in river-shore scrub and ambushing unwary passersby.

name: Inkscale Deepseeker
description: Schools of tidestallions will viciously slam their muscular chests into their prey to take them down.

name: Crimson Tidestallion
description: The blood-red coloration of these creatures is ideal for hiding in large coral formations.

name: Fabious
description: He emerges from the water, fins swaying lazily in the breeze, sun-kissed scales glittering. He is... Fabious.

name: Cloudwing Hippogryph
description: Moreso than normal hippogryphs, the cloudwings of Azsuna prefer to nest high up in mountain caves far above the cloud line.

name: Val'sharah Hippogryph
description: These majestic hippogryphs are as close to a being of the Emerald Dream as any resident of Azeroth can be, and do not bond with a rider easily.

name: Teldrassil Hippogryph
description: One of the last of the great armored hippogryphs to escape the burning of Teldrassil, it carried the last few citizens it could to safety before collapsing of exhaustion.

name: The Hivemind
description: A true union of minds.

name: Highmountain Thunderhoof
description: A gift from the tauren who trained this sure-footed highland moose to safely traverse the paths and peaks of Highmountain.

name: Bloodflank Charger
description: Stolen from the Arathi Basin stables, this fire-hearted charger now steeds for the Horde.

name: Prestigious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Orgrimmar Interceptor
description: A forward-mounted wolf's head cannon makes this air superiority fighter especially good at dogfighting.

name: Shimmermist Runner
description: Mischievous spriggans and the valerunners have a natural enmity. No valerunner would deign to allow a spriggan rider because they can sense their inherent malevolence. This angers the trickster spriggans who take twisted enjoyment in playing cruel pranks on these majestic creatures.

name: Swift Gloomhoof
description: The ballads of Ardenweald claim that the birth of gloomrunner heralds the passing of a particularly benevolent wild god. Seeing a gloomrunner is therefore a blessing and a curse.

name: Maelie, the Wanderer
description: A curious and inquisitive doe, she doesn't mean to worry her master, she just gets distracted easily. Especially with all of the new things to see on Korthia.

name: Ascended Skymane
description: Only those that have proven themselves against the combined might of the Ascended will be able to ride this mount.

name: Dauntless Duskrunner
description: The Path of Ascension is a challenging trial, and those that display all of the facets the Kyrian hold dear will be duly rewarded.

name: Sundancer
description: This sun-dappled courser gallops on lightbeams with carefree abandon.

name: Wild Dreamrunner
description: Dreamrunners flit between this world and the Emerald Dream at will, reveling in their wild nature.

name: Prestigious Bronze Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Prestigious Midnight Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Prestigious Bloodforged Courser
description: Forged in a fiery hatred, the offspring of a nightmare and a dream, this steed feeds on grains grown with the tears of your enemies.

name: Prestigious Forest Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Prestigious Ivory Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Prestigious Royal Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Prestigious Azure Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Lucid Nightmare
description: When riding this mount, your thoughts often wander to far-off places.

name: Pureheart Courser
description: These coursers have long been known to exist, but only befriend those that have gone to great lengths for friendship.

name: Sinrunner Blanchy
description: In life, Blanchy appeared to be an affectionate, well-behaved horse of excellent disposition and appetite. What evils must she have committed in secret to have earned her place among the condemned souls of Revendreth?

name: Court Sinrunner
description: Sinrunners were once the steeds of dark souls, carried in the wake of either their sins or their masters' sins to Revendreth. While some chose to run free, many continue to serve darkness in death as they did in life.

name: Kul Tiran Charger
description: The Kul Tiran military prides itself on mastery of both sea, through a vast navy, and land, with armed cavalry.

name: Xiwyllag ATV
description: It was said that this invention was modeled after the likeness of a very wealthy goblin. Although others don't really see the resemblance.

name: Swift Spectral Magnetocraft
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Mimiron's Jumpjets
description: Created as a prototype by Mimiron. The pieces were stolen from his workshop, sold, and lost to time. That is until now..

name: Rustbolt Resistor
description: "R E S I S T" is carved into the seat in crude letters, along with several, more profane things.

name: Aerial Unit R-21/X
description: King Mechagon's private aerial unit, complete with deployable blast cannon and foot warmers.

name: Huntmaster's Loyal Wolfhawk
description: The spirit of the Great Hunter found you worthy, and now its children will answer your call forevermore.

name: Huntmaster's Dire Wolfhawk
description: If asked to fetch, will most likely bring you back the head of a small mammal or humanoid.

name: Huntmaster's Fierce Wolfhawk
description: A jumble of talons and claws that can fly and swim. No one is safe.

name: Alabaster Hyena
description: These hyena are used by the Voldunai to quickly move unseen throughout the sands.

name: Dune Scavenger
description: These resilient scavengers can survive for months in the wastes of Vol'dun with scarce access to food and water.

name: Frostshard Infernal
description: These icy minions come from an unknown plane far from this one.

name: Coldflame Infernal
description: The strange icy flames cause you to sweat and shiver at the same time.

name: Felblaze Infernal
description: The Illidari were able to break one of these fiery beasts for use as an unstoppable, fearless mount against the Legion.

name: Flarecore Infernal
description: The Legion has conquered thousands of other planets, devising fiendish alterations to their war machines when faced with extreme conditions.

name: Hellfire Infernal
description: From the bowels of the nether is summoned a creature of pure hatred, bent on burning down any life in its way.

name: Beastlord's Irontusk
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, its tusks can pierce even the hardest Iron Horde steel.

name: Armored Irontusk
description: It is said an elekk never forgets. No wonder it despises the Iron Horde, considering the torment the orcs put the beast through.

name: Ironhoof Destroyer
description: Blackhand is said to have personally designed the fiery armaments used on the Iron Horde's clefthoof battle mounts.

name: Corridor Creeper
description: The loyal hounds of the Jailer creep along the corridors in search of the scent of souls.

name: Mawsworn Soulhunter
description: Soulhunters are used to track wayward souls across the wastes that flee from their dark fates, and are one of the only creatures that feel comfortable traversing the maw.

name: Bound Shadehound
description: Created by deciphering and performing powerful runic magic, this Shadehound is bound to its creator.

name: Armored Vorquin Leystrider
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Swift Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Guardian Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Majestic Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Obsidian Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Sapphire Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Bronze Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Crimson Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Cindermane Charger
description: Formed by Ragnaros himself as a gift for the daughter he never had.

name: Gorestrider Gronnling
description: Once "befriended", a gronnling will happily carry its rider to their death.

name: Sunhide Gronnling
description: Loves the sun, hates everything else.

name: Coalfist Gronnling
description: This little gronnling is well-known for smashing his way into garrison inns and making a mess of the pots and pans.

name: Lightforged Felcrusher
description: A gift of thanks from the Lightforged draenei, this stalwart elekk is conditioned to charge headlong into darkness without fear.

name: Glorious Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Blessed Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Avenging Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Lightforged Warframe
description: The Army of the Light conducts quick, brutal hit-and-run attacks using these agile war machines.

name: Lightforged Ruinstrider
description: A loyal steed to the Lightforged Draenei.

name: Archmage's Prismatic Disc
description: Three elements have been fused to create this magical disc, which is attuned to your specific magical powers.

name: Blisterback Bloodtusk
description: The House of the Chosen train their mounts in all manner of difficult circumstances, so that no matter the battle, they will never falter.

name: Gorespine
description: Nerissa trampled over countless bodies on the back of Gorespine as she rose to prominence as the commander of the Lichsworn forces for the House of Rituals.

name: Lurid Bloodtusk
description: Only bloodtusks that survive the Contest of Conquest are deemed worthy enough to become a mount of the Undying Army.

name: Gruesome Flayedwing
description: The flayedwings of Maldraxxus are prized for their ability to soar effortlessly through the skies of the Shadowlands, allowing their rider a surprise opportunity to strike at their foes or support their allies.

name: Callow Flayedwing
description: Flayedwings are a necessary force in the cycle of life for the Shadowlands, acting as both prey and predator for the harsh environment of Maldraxxus.

name: Marrowfang
description: Marrowfang, Bonefang's progeny, was respected by Amarth the Harvester for her insatiable appetite, even if it disrupted any experiments that the sadistic commander wanted to run.

name: Subterranean Magmammoth
description: Awakened from a long slumber, this beast has yet to see the light of day.

name: Loyal Magmammoth
description: Liberated from the Qalashi and harnessed by your ingenuity (and your harness), this magmammoth is ready to lava stomp wherever you want to go.

name: Raging Magmammoth
description: Most lava flows. This lava charges.

name: Renewed Magmammoth
description: Reforged after destruction at the hands of the Druids of the Flame, this magmammoth is ready to stomp any foes in its path.

name: Mossy Mammoth
description: Preserved for thousands of years in stone, bronze magic has nearly aged this mammoth back into a fossil.

name: Plainswalker Bearer
description: The mammoths of the Ohn'ahran Plains are unaccustomed to carrying people, as their centaur neighbors do not typically ride mounts. They can learn to bear riders, however. Some even do so enthusiastically.

name: Infested Necroray
description: Necrorays lay their eggs in small clusters within the frills and hollows of decaying fungal blooms.

name: Pestilent Necroray
description: When a necroray hatches, spores fly everywhere, making a huge mess.

name: Darkspore Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Lambent Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Bulbous Necroray
description: The necrorays of Maldraxxus prefer to congregate around the enormous decaying mushrooms of the region.

name: Scintillating Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Vibrant Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Felglow Mana Ray
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Beryl Shardhide
description: These shardhides find it easy to hide in the underbrush, and it is rare to find one that is tamed.

name: Darkmaul
description: An older shardhide, Darkmaul was relatively tame and friendly around Korthians. He was thought lost to the calamity.

name: Crimson Shardhide
description: When Korthia was pulled into the maw, only a few hardy species survived.

name: Amber Shardhide
description: The bright colors of Korthian wildlife indicate that they have either few predators, or are tough enough to fight back.

name: Fierce Razorwing
description: Razorwings generally stay away from other Korthian species, but with time and patience, they can be tamed as well.

name: Dusklight Razorwing
description: Razorwings can be seen throughout Korthia, making their nests on high hills and in trees.

name: Garnet Razorwing
description: Korthia was once known for its bright red flowers. Several species were known for consuming or rolling in them, and taking on bright red coloration as a result.

name: Soaring Razorwing
description: The hide of the razorwing is light, allowing it to fly, but also quite tough, allowing them to survive passage into the Maw.

name: Colossal Soulshredder Mawrat
description: The incredible prowess you have demonstrated within the Jailer's Tower has instilled sufficient respect into this fearsome creature, enabling its use as a mount.

name: Colossal Plaguespew Mawrat
description: These rodents became Iska's infamous sentries, scouting and carrying her plague across the Maw. Their presence is only followed by ruin.

name: Colossal Umbrahide Mawrat
description: This disturbingly large Mawrat is an anomaly amongst its species. These Colossal Mawrats lurk only in the most distant and darkest reaches of Torghast.

name: Colossal Wraithbound Mawrat
description: Infused by the energies of tormented souls, these creatures have adopted ghostlike abilities that make them quite elusive.

name: Colossal Ebonclaw Mawrat
description: This vicious and cunning creature has grown to its astonishing size by not only feasting upon the weakened souls in the Jailer's Tower, but also vulnerable Mawsworn.

name: Mechacycle Model W
description: The rapid technological evolution of the descendents of Mimiron began with the introduction of a new gear, leading to such wonders as the tragically under-produced Model W.

name: Junkheap Drifter
description: When you really want to be noticed... and don't mind strapping yourself to a giant, barely-held-together wheel.

name: Mechagon Mechanostrider
description: The best mount, logically, serves multiple purposes -- sometimes you need to get places AND reach something high up once you get there.

name: Mechagon Peacekeeper
description: Keeps the peace by turning you into pieces.

name: Rusty Mechanocrawler
description: The check engine light is always on, it's when it goes off that you should be worried.

name: Scrapforged Mechaspider
description: You built this yourself, you should be proud, even though it's smoky, sparky, and loud.

name: Wonderwing 2.0
description: Don't ask what happened to the first one -- Mechagon technology is still gnome technology!

name: X-995 Mechanocat
description: The X-995 is the ultimate in customizeable feline robo-companionship.

name: Ravenous Black Gryphon
description: War corrupted these once-proud creatures. The susurration of their wings now whispers omens of imminent demise.

name: Grand Gryphon
description: Gryphons' keen eyesight allows them to see over vast distances and warn their riders of any dangers that lie ahead.

name: Harbor Gryphon
description: This gryphon was the runt of its pride, left behind when its brethren were sent for training. Today, however, it is ready to prove its worth.

name: Grand Armored Gryphon
description: This noble gryphon is as staunch a battle companion as any member of the Alliance could ask for.

name: Swift Spectral Armored Gryphon
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Dusky Waycrest Gryphon
description: Common to the dark forests of Drustvar, these gryphon are silent and swift. Their prowess at operating on their own or as mounts lends them to be used for ambush and shock tactics.

name: Stormsong Coastwatcher
description: Tasked with keeping watch on the seas for approaching dangers, the Stormsong Coastwatchers fly constant patrols.

name: Proudmoore Sea Scout
description: Only a few gryphons are selected to be Sea Scouts operating from flag ships in the fleet. Their long range reconnaissance is an integral part of Kul Tiran sea dominance.

name: Emerald Hippogryph
description: These majestic animals come in various colorings, but the emerald variety can only be tamed by the magic of friendship.

name: Grand Wyvern
description: Wyverns hail from some of the most inhospitable regions of Kalimdor, making them masters of adapting to any environment.

name: Grand Armored Wyvern
description: This ferocious beast, renowned among wyvern handlers, was one of the first mounts chosen to take part in the Horde's Dominance Offensive.

name: Mimiron's Head
description: A token of titan craftsmanship hoarded by the Old God, Yogg-Saron. Currently the single largest mechanical gnome head in Azeroth.

name: Surf Jelly
description: The time between being stung and being enveloped and devoured is short enough to consider not swimming in the Great Sea.

name: Sea Turtle
description: Often caught by fishermen at a young age, these mounts are much more comfortable in the water than they are on land.

name: Sharkbait
description: Sharkbait's loyalty lies with whomever keeps the crackers coming.

name: Tan Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Dark War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Cobalt War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: White War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Cobalt Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Silver War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: White Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Dark Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Silver Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Tan War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Frostwolf Howler
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan.

name: Goblin Trike
description: A compilation of nuts, bolts, gears, and treated wood paneling make for an unusually smooth ride.

name: Goblin Turbo-Trike
description: The turbo trike's tri-wheel design adds superior stability and a smaller turn radius over its two wheeled cousins.

name: Mechano-Hog
description: Difficult to build and to maintain, these hogs more than make up for their expense through sheer cool factor.

name: Chauffeured Mechano-Hog
description: Why drive yourself around when you can hire someone to do it for you?

name: Chauffeured Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Transportation is a precise business.

name: Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Sporting superb engineering craftsmanship, this chopper is one of the few personal vehicles on Azeroth built for two.

name: Stonehide Elderhorn
description: Stonehide elderhorns, one of the few types of moose to inhabit island climates, have thinner fur than most elderhorns.

name: Corrupted Fire Hawk
description: Millagazor was a fire hawk loyal to Ragnaros. At this time it is unknown how many of Millagazor's eggs were corrupted.

name: Pureblood Fire Hawk
description: Legends state that the Pureblood line may be traced back to the very creation of the Firelands.

name: Craghorn Chasm-Leaper
description: These mighty leapers have adapted to island life by learning to catch seagulls swooping through crags and fissures.

name: Challenger's War Yeti
description: Thankfully they move fast and mostly leave the smell behind them.

name: Minion of Grumpus
description: No one quite knows when the legend of Grumpus began in Draenor, but his toys are just the worst.

name: Yellow Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Red Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Red Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Green Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Blue Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Blue Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Black Qiraji Battle Tank
description: Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.

name: Black Qiraji Battle Tank
description: Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.

name: Black Qiraji Battle Tank
description: Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.

name: Obsidian Nightwing
description: When you can't run, you crawl, and when you can't crawl you find someone to carry you.

name: Vitreous Stone Drake
description: Those would be perfect in a pendant, and that would make a fantastic ring. Let me know if this thing sheds or molts or whatever. -Kalinda

name: Phosphorescent Stone Drake
description: The Stonemother has shown little concern for the rebellious Aeonaxx, even allowing his spawn to be taken from her realm.

name: Volcanic Stone Drake
description: Fire can transform stone in exciting ways, but never let the Stonemother know I said that. -Earthcaller Yevaa

name: Drake of the West Wind
description: Harnessing the elemental powers of the storm, these majestic beasts crackle like lightning and roar like thunder.

name: Drake of the North Wind
description: They sicken of the calm who know the storm.

name: Drake of the South Wind
description: Gentle as a summer breeze, but that says little considering where it came from. -Itesh

name: Drake of the East Wind
description: In Deathwing's mad quest to forge new dragons, he ignored amazing breeds never before seen on Azeroth. -Thrall

name: Felfire Hawk
description: Felfire is deadly to the touch.  Luckily, the hawk can suppress the flames, choosing not to incinerate its rider in an emerald effigy.

name: Ashes of Al'ar
description: Al'ar was the beloved pet of Kael'thas Sunstrider, who often boasted that death would never claim it. Perhaps he was right.

name: Ban-Lu, Grandmaster's Companion
description: The child of Xuen, Ban-Lu has served each Grandmaster faithfully for many years.

name: Noble Bruffalon
description: It is a great honor to be trusted with one of the Maruuk's loyal hunting companions. This Bruffalon is reliable and steadfast through any hardship.

name: Grove Warden
description: These magical companions are the wardens of peaceful, primordial groves within the Emerald Dream.

name: Highmountain Elderhorn
description: The favored mount of Highmountain hunters, they can easily leap across the rushing rivers of Pinerock Basin even when saddled with a full-sized Tauren.

name: Grove Defiler
description: The Grove Wardens of the Emerald Dream were some of the first to fall to the corrupting influence of the Nightmare.

name: Silky Shimmermoth
description: The moths of Ardenweald play a vital role in the ecosystem, carrying spores, anima, and pollen from one part of the forest to the other, providing nourishment and variation to the denizens living below.

name: Duskflutter Ardenmoth
description: These ardenmoths prefer the dark and damp forests of northwest Ardenweald, where fungal colonies are perpetually blooming.

name: Vibrant Flutterwing
description: These minty green moths are very friendly. They particularly enjoy having their head fuzz vigorously brushed. They also enjoy music and poetry.

name: Amber Ardenmoth
description: The brilliant orange hue of the amber ardenmoth signals to predators that it is dangerous to eat. Consuming one of these creatures will put a predator into a dreamless sleep for years.

name: Golden King
description: Don't let the saddle fool you, he's wild, not a tame lion.

name: Dark Phoenix
description: Despite their name, Dark Phoenixes are known to have a warm and cheerful disposition.

name: Leyfeather Hippogryph
description: Ancient mounts of the Highborne, now left to run wild in the Broken Isles, they can rarely be found due to their latent magical powers.

name: Swift Spectral Hippogryph
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Kor'kron Annihilator
description: Vicious in battle and surprisingly loyal, this battle scorpion serves only those who show true commitment to a powerful guild.

name: Kor'kron Juggernaut
description: The Kor'kron Juggernaut is a weapon of unbridled destruction, born from the mind of Garrosh Hellscream and made real by his engineers.

name: Spectral Steed
description: Dark spirits flee before the radiance of its presence.

name: Spectral Wolf
description: Fears only fire.

name: Vicious War Bear
description: Almost twice as vicious as its Horde counterpart.

name: Vicious War Bear
description: Nearly twice as vicious as its Alliance counterpart.

name: Vicious Gilnean Warhorse
description: Born, bred and battle tested in Gilneas.

name: Winged Guardian
description: Unearthed recently in an ancient tomb, this mighty winged lion may have once served one of the ancient Tol'vir princes.

name: Gargantuan Grrloc
description: It's the biggest murloc you've ever seen!

name: Ginormous Grrloc
description: It's the second biggest murloc you've ever seen!

name: Brawler's Burly Mushan Beast
description: For years pandaren believed these creatures to be untamable. Just ask the first pandaren to do so, Henshi "Limp Along" Homebrew.

name: Son of Galleon
description: Trained from a young age, these massive kushan are taught to thunder into battle carrying a full saurok warband.

name: Ashhide Mushan Beast
description: Some people say that riding an ashhide mushan will result in favorable health and increased prosperity. These people are called "mount vendors."

name: Smoldering Ember Wyrm
description: Arcanagos sought to turn Medivh away from experiments into the arcane, but the influence of Sargeras had corrupted the wizard too deeply, and the great dragon paid for the transgression with eternal, burning agony.

name: Nightborne Manasaber
description: Born capable of sniffing out concentrations of arcane energy, this noble cat was presented with thanks to a proven ally of the nightborne.

name: Umber Nightsaber
description: Nightsabers are an integral part of the Kaldorei's army, serving as both mount and assault weapon in one.

name: Kaldorei Nightsaber
description: The connection between a nightsaber and its hunter or huntress is nearly inseparable.

name: Priestess' Moonsaber
description: Once these elegant cats were only given to high-ranking priestesses of Elune, but now they ride into battle with all manner of champion, in the service of vengeance.

name: Sandy Nightsaber
description: A rare color for a nightsaber, and rarely seen, they are prized amongst huntresses.

name: Slime Serpent
description: This mysterious creature lurks beneath the slime pools of Plaguefall. No one knows where it came from.

name: Black Serpent of N'Zoth
description: The black serpents of N'Zoth are the harbingers of his ultimate vision becoming reality. Only those servents or enemies that can tread this space have any chance of wrangling them.

name: Awakened Mindborer
description: It may look menacing right now, but it's actually kind of cute when it's asleep.

name: Wriggling Parasite
description: It's so wiggly! Just looking at it move is chaotic and unnerving.

name: Mail Muncher
description: Worming its way through the Postmaster's network, this serpent of N'Zoth deprived Azeroth of its primary magical correspondence.

name: Lucky Yun
description: The Pandaren believe that merely rubbing one's hands on the shiny hide of the ox will grant prosperity, the challenge is catching it.

name: Highlord's Golden Charger
description: The fanciest of all of the horses.

name: Highlord's Vigilant Charger
description: His blank horse stare is "vigilance," actually.

name: Highlord's Vengeful Charger
description: What's he so mad about?

name: Highlord's Valorous Charger
description: Has many valorous points.

name: Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents are born with violet scales covering the entirety of their body. Over time, these scales darken to the color of onyx.

name: Heavenly Golden Cloud Serpent
description: Warmth and hope emanate from this great creature, which glows like a sunrise over the mountains.

name: Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpent
description: Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpents are considered to be among the noblest of dragons.

name: Crimson Cloud Serpent
description: Crimson Cloud Serpents are given to flights of fancy, striking out on a whim for seemingly random journeys, sometimes for days at a time.

name: Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: Onyx Cloud serpents are known to be more aggressive and daring than their cousins, the Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents.

name: Azure Cloud Serpent
description: Azure Cloud Serpents are believed by the Pandaren to be harbingers of good fortune.

name: Jade Cloud Serpent
description: Jade Cloud Serpents are light and agile; quick and deadly.

name: Thundering Ruby Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Thundering Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: This ebony cloud serpent is a lightning-wreathed vision of such rarity as to have driven many mortals to madness.

name: Thundering Cobalt Cloud Serpent
description: This is a descendant of the irascible Nalak. Lightning erupts from its scales and arcs over the saddle. Dare you sit?

name: Thundering Jade Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Thundering August Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Magenta Cloud Serpent
description: More affectionate than their cousins, Magenta Cloud Serpents are known to form close bonds with their riders.

name: Rajani Warserpent
description: Fierce companions of the followers of Ra-den, the Rajani Warserpents are a force to be reckoned with.

name: Tyrannical Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These cloud serpents always look elegant and slim in classic black.

name: Grievous Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that are a mixture of ruby, gold, and nearly violet.

name: Prideful Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that range from gold to pink. Or we could call it coral.

name: Ivory Cloud Serpent
description: Ivory Cloud Serpents are often mistaken for roaring thunder as they tear through the skies with blistering speed.

name: Malevolent Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These cloud serpents have scales that... are the color of clouds, actually.

name: Golden Cloud Serpent
description: Golden Cloud Serpents are a treasure to be enjoyed by all who visit the continent of Pandaria.

name: Squawks
description: Guess why he's called that? It's not because he's a nice, quiet pet.

name: Quawks
description: Squawks's older (and somehow louder) brother appears to tolerate your presence. For now. You should probably track down some crackers while you still can.

name: Hearthsteed
description: Each step echoes with the rage of your three opponents.

name: Goldplate Bufonid
description: This armored bufonid is always ready to leap into battle... as long as that battle is really, really close. In a pinch, it can leap multiple times and eventually reach the battle.

name: Patient Bufonid
description: Some bufonids will sit perfectly still for hours or days at a time if left to their own devices. Fortunately, they're also quite agreeable if a rider would like to move more often than that.

name: Prototype Leaper
description: An ancient schematic allows for the instantiation of this early, but functional, bufonid design.

name: Russet Bufonid
description: Russet is a rare color among bufonids that is normally only seen on specimens that are tainted by other cosmic forces, or synthesized from a perplexing schematic that invokes that color.

name: High Priest's Lightsworn Seeker
description: Once plentiful, only three seekers remain on Azeroth after generations of battling the corruption of the cosmos.

name: Tamed Skitterfly
description: It didn't take long for Granpap Whiskers to tame the skitterflies around the Dragonscale Basecamp and set them to helping move Expedition personnel and cargo.

name: Azure Skitterfly
description: Once Granpap Whiskers finally taught them how to take riders, the azure skitterflies proved to bond closely and loyally to their riders.

name: Verdant Skitterfly
description: Verdant skitterflies are the perfect mount for the scouts of the Dragonscale Expedition scouts, as they are fast and blend into the foliage of the Dragon Isles.

name: Zereth Overseer
description: Enigmatic and aloof, this construct of the First Ones flies on a graceful stream of perfect geometric understanding.

name: Carcinized Zerethsteed
description: The few of these mysterious creatures that remain appear to be impossibly old, almost timeless. Perhaps they were created by the First Ones, because no schematic to synthesize these has yet been discovered.

name: Desertwing Hunter
description: In service of the great Purpose, desertwing hunters were designed to fill distant skies of forgotten realms of the Shadowlands.

name: Mawdapted Raptora
description: Since the Jailer's incursion, new raptora have been synthesized by Zereth Mortis that are capable of resisting the corrupting influence of the Maw.

name: Raptora Swooper
description: The raptora swooper is one of the most vicious iterations of its kind, perfectly suited for its ecological niche. Needing no further adjustments, the ones synthesized today are identical to those created in the past.

name: Serenade
description: These beautiful helicids emerge only at night. When they are pleased, their shells hum with a joyful melody.

name: Bronze Helicid
description: Some helicids of Zereth Mortis have strangely metallic shells. The ones who do are generally a bronze color, indistinct from the metal any novice miner could work, save that this creature's construction far surpasses the skill of any novice.

name: Unsuccessful Prototype Fleetpod
description: This creature was not designed by the First Ones, but instead by an unknown being attempting to create a very fast runner. Needless to say the attempt failed, because this mount is very slow.

name: Scarlet Helicid
description: This helicid's unusual reddish tint is clearly intentional in its design, but the only other difference between these and other helicids is the unusual lack of any ooze.

name: Genesis Crawler
description: The Enlightened who have observed tarachnids believe that this variety may be some of the first beings to ever walk the land of Zereth Mortis.

name: Tarachnid Creeper
description: These tarachnids make their home in the darkest corners of Zereth Mortis, coming out only to hunt (or, sometimes, carry a rider around).

name: Ineffable Skitterer
description: These tarachnids move with a purpose unknown to others, answering only to a higher calling. Whatever that may be, it appears to include routine assistance to mortals who need a ride. For now.

name: Pale Regal Cervid
description: Looking at these majestic creatures, it's not difficult to see how the idea of cervids developed into the stags found on Azeroth and other mortal worlds.

name: Sundered Zerethsteed
description: Whatever the purpose of these cervids once was, it is long forgotten. Though they are not Dominated, they have been corrupted by the unintended presence of Mawsworn in the sacred realm of Zereth Mortis.

name: Anointed Protostag
description: Only those most esteemed by the Enlightened are trusted with the reins of this rare cervid.

name: Deathrunner
description: These wild cervids are only truly at peace when running through--or between--the lands of Death.

name: Vespoid Flutterer
description: A flutterer is an overgrown vespoid worker created to carry a rider. Rather than looking to a queen for leadership, it looks to its rider to guide it in all things.

name: Bronzewing Vespoid
description: Bronzewing vespoids are the result of attempting to synthesize a vespoid queen with no other members of a new hive. While no mortal has yet discovered how to synthesize a hive, the bronzewings are reliable mounts just as they are.

name: Forged Spiteflyer
description: There's nothing that can make you feel as alive quite like riding through the realm of Death while atop a being that hates you.

name: Buzz
description: Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz! Buzz buzz buzz buzz buzz. Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.

name: Heartbond Lupine
description: From the moment of its creation, this packless lupine has held nothing more than deepest affection and loyalty towards you.

name: Heartlight Vombata
description: The Enlightened revere all creations of the First Ones, yet for many, the vombata of Zereth Mortis are the most beloved. These creatures are equal parts trusted beast of burden and beloved companion.

name: Darkened Vombata
description: The schematic to synthesize these darkened vombata seem to have appeared as a reaction to the Mawsworn invasion. The resulting vombata look different--darker, much like the invaders--but behave normally.

name: Curious Crystalsniffer
description: Most vombata enjoy tunneling through the ground, but these sniffers seem to have an unerring ability to locate crystals buried deep underground and will congregate around large deposits.

name: Adorned Vombata
description: Red-colored vombata are considered lucky by the Enlightened. It was a red vombata that was present when they first arrived in Zereth Mortis.

name: Frostbrood Proto-Wyrm
description: The same magic of undeath that raised the Frostbrood into the Lich King's service has infused this primal wyrm. Its loyalty and ferocity now serve those who defend Azeroth.

name: Corrupted Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Cobalt Pterrordax
description: These pterrordax keep vigil for enemy fleets soaring above the coasts of Zandalar.

name: Dazar'alor Windreaver
description: Soaring high above the Battle of Dazar'alor, these beasts are drawn to the most cunning of victors.

name: Armored Golden Pterrordax
description: Painted and adorned with gold, these Pterrordax patrol the skies over the tomb of Atal'Dazar.

name: Captured Swampstalker
description: A swamp-dwelling subspecies of pterrordax known to feast on young bloodfeasters.

name: Voldunai Dunescraper
description: These brightly-colored fliers are rarely captured in the wild due to their naturally untrusting natures.

name: Scarlet Pterrordax
description: This pterrordax was so eager to take to the skies that its handler couldn't finish training it.

name: Swift Spectral Drake
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Spectral Pterrorwing
description: Vengeful spectres abound in the spirit realm surrounding Dazar'alor.

name: Swift Spectral Pterrordax
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Kua'fon
description: Once a little hatchling, raised into a mighty pterrordax by a loving handler. He never did learn to fly.

name: Xinlao
description: The only thing stronger than a quilen's loyalty is its fierce devotion to making sure it covers its owner in kisses.

name: Ren's Stalwart Hound
description: Houndlord Ren used his strongest quilen to carry him across Pandaria to subjugate the Vale for the Mogu empire.

name: Jade, Bright Foreseer
description: The presence of this majestic Pandaren rabbit spirit brings joy and happiness and is heralded as a wonderful omen. Legend says that in its eyes, you can glimpse the greatest happiness of your life, even if it is yet to come.

name: Ratstallion
description: Years of chain-chugging potions in Dalaran's sewer system have allowed him to grow large, agile, and shadow resistant.

name: Dread Raven
description: Filled with the hatred of an ancient god, the dread raven are the Arakkoa's most trusted guardians.

name: Inferno Armoredon
description: Its tail smells like campfire but its breath smells like brimstone.

name: Hailstorm Armoredon
description: Born in the middle of an ice storm, this armoredon prefers its meals partially frozen.

name: Black Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Iskaara Trader's Ottuk
description: There are no guarantees when you purchase an ottuk from Tattukiaka. At least they're cute.

name: Otto
description: Relax. The future will unfold as it was meant to, one way or an otter.

name: Brown Scouting Ottuk
description: Wily and playful in their natural habitat, ottuks possess keen eyes that can scout far afield as ably as they watch for predators.

name: Ivory Trader's Ottuk
description: No adult knows why some ottuks are white, but any tuskarr child can tell you: it's because they eat too much snow.

name: Yellow Scouting Ottuk
description: The yellow scouting ottuk love to hide and they blend in well to their surroundings. When not 'playing' hide and seek with their riders, they are perfect companions when scouting enemy encampments.

name: Brown War Ottuk
description: The tuskarr of Iskaara are loathe to war against anyone, but many tuskarr and their allies have nonetheless taken up the spear with a war ottuk beside them.

name: Otterworldly Ottuk Carrier
description: Some ottuks get into the spirit of carrying people around more than others.

name: Yellow War Ottuk
description: The yellow ottuks of the Azure Span are sleek, sneaky, and smart. Those trained for war are the finest tuskarr cavalry mounts, equally capable on the ground and in the waters.

name: X-45 Heartbreaker
description: Apothecary Hummel painted this masterpiece bright pink for an unrequited love.

name: Colossal Slaughterclaw
description: Only the most stalwart stable masters of Maldraxxus are able to break the will of the colossal slaughterclaws, giving all champions of the Undying Army a fearsome ally in the Shadowlands.

name: Predatory Plagueroc
description: Geiger's everlasting hunger is legendary amonst the House of Constructs, and no beast is too large or bony to fit inside its massive stomach.

name: Hulking Deathroc
description: Deathrocs are stitched monstrosities from the discarded viscera, bone, and organs that were not required to construct soldiers for the House of Constructs.

name: Bonesewn Fleshroc
description: Only expert flesh-stitchers who have demonstrated mastery over the magics of Maldraxxus are powerful enough to construct a deathroc of this size.

name: Shadowblade's Murderous Omen
description: The preferred vehicle for assassinations, they make no sounds when flying - really great for sneaking up on people.

name: Shadowblade's Baneful Omen
description: For the toxin-inclined.

name: Shadowblade's Lethal Omen
description: They'll never hear you coming.

name: Shadowblade's Crimson Omen
description: The blood of your enemies won't even show up, blends right in.

name: Mystic Runesaber
description: Infused with arcane power, the Mystic Runesaber has long been hidden by chaotic nether energies. Recently they have emerged from the shadows in search of ley lines to sate their thirst for magic.

name: Ancient Salamanther
description: Due to their preference for dark caves and murky waters, sightings of this unique breed of salamanther are so rare that many researchers thought they had gone extinct.

name: Stormhide Salamanther
description: Sometimes when storm energies infuse a creature, it simply... becomes larger and more placid. Few salamanthers are willing to be ridden, but these children of the storm are a notable exception.

name: Riddler's Mind-Worm
description: It feeds on your thoughts, even the ones you are thinking as you read this.

name: Abyss Worm
description: The shadows that trail off of its scales are otherworldly, is this creature from the depths of Azeroth's oceans?

name: Nazjatar Blood Serpent
description: Monstrous serpents riddled with corruption serve as mounts for N'zoth's high-ranking lieutenants in the Great Sea.

name: Obsidian Gladiator's Slitherdrake
description: This mischievous drake enjoys flying through geysers and volcanic plumes.

name: Sinful Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This mount shows a proclivity for snacking upon the souls cast out of Revendreth.

name: Unchained Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Eternal Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Cosmic Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Luminous Starseeker
description: Energetic apex hunters of Argus, the panthara hunt by sensing the energy within living things. A panthara approaching a powerful energy source will visibly change color and become more excited.

name: Swift Spectral Fathom Ray
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Ankoan Waveray
description: The Ankoan have been battling the naga for years, and with a natural affinity for the sea, training the local wildlife was a natural strategy.

name: Unshackled Waveray
description: The Unshackled have a natural kinship with the species of the deep seas that have seen cruelty at the hands of the naga.

name: Silent Glider
description: Gasses naturally stored within the creature allowed it to survive within the depths, those same gasses also allow them to effortlessly float through the air.

name: Coral-Stalker Waveray
description: This species of ray seems to have evolved to stalk its prey amidst the brightly colored corals of the seas.

name: Azshari Bloatray
description: The naga raised these rays in captivity, harvesting their gas organs to craft alchemy which allowed them to breathe air more easily.

name: Vicious Skeletal Warhorse
description: Only rewarded to those who have bested their foes in battle.

name: Vicious Black Bonesteed
description: These skeletal steeds know no fear, eat no grains, and can travel impossible distances.

name: Vicious White Bonesteed
description: There are few other ways to ride in to battle that feature as many spikes and bones.

name: Midnight
description: Still one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.

name: Seething Slug
description: Drawn forth from its abyss by the rage of the Zaqali.

name: Gooey Snailemental
description: Formed from the leftover elemental energies of the Primal Storms, this magical mollusk is faster than it appears.

name: Magmashell
description: Who's a good little new-forged snail made entirely of elemental lava? You are! Yes, you!

name: Shellack
description: Fed by victory and hardened by glory, this snail is nothing less than a tribute to mastery.

name: Scrappy Worldsnail
description: For the Worldbreakers, a portable footstool. For you, a hardy mount.

name: Big Slick in the City
description: Big heart, big dreams, Big Slick.

name: Royal Snapdragon
description: Captured at a young age and raised to serve naga hunters, snapdragons are loyal and fierce companions.

name: Snapdragon Kelpstalker
description: When a snapdragon bites you, the worry isn't about the bite itself, but the poison that will begin to eat away at the wound.

name: Deepcoral Snapdragon
description: The snapdragon is a quiet hunter in the water, but is far less stealthy on land.

name: Shackled Ur'zul
description: Formed from the tormented bodies and souls of fallen members of the Army of the Light, the Ur'zul is both fascinating and horrifying.

name: Bloodfang Widow
description: Its long, serrated limbs drip with the blood of its enemies and/or mate.

name: Cobalt Shalewing
description: Brood of Karoktra, raised in the underlight of Zaralek Cavern.

name: Shadowflame Shalewing
description: Born from the magma, its carapace was originally molten blobs cooled to form dark-colored volcanic rock. Being imbued by shadowflame has only solidified its unbreakable nature.

name: Cataloged Shalewing
description: The first instance of a flaming shalewing ever discovered. Nine out of ten researchers agree: it's hot!

name: Igneous Shalewing
description: You'd be forgiven for mistaking this creature for a flying volcanic rock. Because to some extent, it is.

name: Morsel Sniffer
description: A breed of shalewings trained by the niffen to find the deepest of morsels.

name: Sandy Shalewing
description: The patterns on the wings of that creature resemble sand flowing through an hourglass. One could gaze upon them for ages...

name: Boulder Hauler
description: These shalewings have been specially trained to carry large amounts of Barter Boulders for the niffen's bartering activities.

name: Darkwater Skate
description: Little is known about this elusive species of ray, found only in the dark waters surrounding Darkmoon Island.

name: Great Sea Ray
description: The rays of the great sea can travel for many miles in great migratory patterns.

name: Vindictive Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Valarjar Stormwing
description: The beating of its wings sound like the rolling of thunder in the distance.

name: Demonic Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Felstorm Dragon
description: The Burning Legion defeated dragons in a distant timeway. These foul fel wyrms chose corruption and servitude over destruction.

name: Island Thunderscale
description: One of the larger native dragon species on Azeroth, this subspecies subsists almost entirely on fish. And fishermen.

name: Fearless Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Cruel Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Ferocious Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Fierce Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Dominant Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Stormpike Battle Ram
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Stormpike Clan, trained to headbutt orcs.

name: Leywoven Flying Carpet
description: The threads are so thin and well-stitched, you can't imagine it wasn't made by magic, strand by strand.

name: Arcanist's Manasaber
description: Upon her return to The Nighthold, First Arcanist Thalyssra saw to it that adventurers who helped her liberate Suramar were rewarded with prized mounts from the royal stable.\r\n\r\nSummoning this mount in Suramar City will also apply Masquerade.

name: Creeping Carpet
description: Can't fly, but can creep very quickly.

name: Skyskin Hornstrider
description: The instability of primalist storms in potential timelines sometimes causes creatures to absorb the energies from the very storms. These creatures tend to be docile towards those who are able to face the fury of these chronomatic anomalies.

name: Clutch of Ha-Li
description: The brood of Ha-Li are comfortable in the blue skies of Pandaria, hunting unsuspecting prey.

name: Lizi, Thunderspine Tramper
description: Nothing will stop Lizi from her mission to eat all the world's fruit.

name: Arboreal Gulper
description: The wood and foliage growing atop this toad is a natural part of its body, helping it siphon anima from the air to nourish itself.

name: Child of Torcali
description: This daughter of the great direhorn loa, Torcali, never lost faith that her keeper would help her grow to her full potential.

name: Zandalari Direhorn
description: The Zandalari pride themselves on being the first to raise and train all of the most ferocious lizards on Azeroth.

name: Obsidian Krolusk
description: This krolusk is marked with proof of surviving scores of trials and hardships.

name: Azureshell Krolusk
description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

name: Conqueror's Scythemaw
description: The battle-hardened shell of this mighty beast can turn aside even the most hefty hammer or sharpened spear.

name: Rubyshell Krolusk
description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

name: Arcadian War Turtle
description: Bred for destruction by an insane warlord in a far-off land, but at least the seat is warm.

name: Savage Green Battle Turtle
description: Turtle too slow to chase down your foes? Just add cannons. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Tuskarr Shoreglider
description: The Tuskarr learned long ago that some of the bones of the sea creatures they hunted were light and buoyant, making for effective glider materials.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Vicious War Riverbeast
description: Riverbeasts are actually one of the most dangerous animals on Azeroth, despite their appearance.

name: Vicious War Spider
description: When being a courageous member of the Alliance doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE ALLIANCE!"

name: Vicious Warstalker
description: Trample the Alliance to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Horde!

name: Vicious War Turtle
description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

name: Vicious War Turtle
description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

name: Vicious War Trike
description: The most devastating technology money can buy.

name: Vicious War Lion
description: Many squires were harmed in the making of this mount.

name: Vicious War Clefthoof
description: The Mag'har bred clefthooves not only as sturdy pack animals, but also powerful instruments of war.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Vicious War Spider
description: When being a bellowing member of the Horde doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE HORDE!"

name: Vicious Warstalker
description: Trample the Horde to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Alliance!

name: Vicious Sabertooth
description: The elite Alliance forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Darnassian as "here kitty kitty".

name: Vicious Sabertooth
description: The elite Horde forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Thalassian as "pspspspsps".

name: Vicious War Snail
description: The Alliance uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

name: Vicious War Snail
description: The Horde uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

name: Vicious War Basilisk
description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

name: Bruce
description: BRUCE!

name: Vicious War Basilisk
description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

name: Vicious War Fox
description: Vicious as a fox.

name: Vicious War Fox
description: Vicious as a fox.

name: Uncorrupted Voidwing
description: This spawn of Vexiona, cleansed by Wrathion, comes from a flight with a fractured past and uncertain future.

name: Caravan Hyena
description: The canopy atop this dune-wanderer can be stored at your campsite, should you desire to feel the wind in your fur.

name: Siltwing Albatross
description: One of the rarest of birds seen on the islands of the Great Sea, and a prized possession amongst traders, if they can capture it.

name: Gold-Toed Albatross
description: Soaring from a distant timeway, this never-before-seen avian variant was born in a world of order.

name: Waste Marauder
description: Larger than most of its kin, this vulture has shown sick and strong beasts alike why they need to fear the skies.

name: Wastewander Skyterror
description: Doubting a Wastewander Skyterror's capabilities is a quick way to find yourself missing a limb.

name: Netherlord's Chaotic Wrathsteed
description: A deadly combination of fel and horse.

name: Netherlord's Brimstone Wrathsteed
description: The smell isn't particularly pleasant, and it REALLY stays with you.

name: Netherlord's Accursed Wrathsteed
description: Shadow plus fire, what could go wrong?

name: Battlelord's Bloodthirsty War Wyrm
description: Also responds to "Mister Bitey."

name: Gilded Prowler
description: The mighty larion is an apex predator of Bastion, but that does not stop it from enjoying a nice nap in the sunny fields.

name: Highwind Darkmane
description: The Forsworn and their mounts take on a darker aspect upon renouncing the path laid forth by the Archon. While tame enough to ride, the Highwind Darkmane has a fiercely independent streak.

name: Silverwind Larion
description: This gift of the silvery winds is only bestowed upon those that search high and low for the wisdom of Bastion.

name: Infernal Direwolf
description: A mighty wolf of Draenor, touched by the fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan in Tanaan Jungle. It has not gone completely mad... yet.

name: Trained Snarler
description: Enormously cute as a puppy. Slightly less so now.

name: Smoky Direwolf
description: Believed to reside mostly in the north. Hates weddings.

name: Warsong Direfang
description: Has a will of iron but is a sweetheart if you give it a clefthoof bone to chew on.

name: Armored Frostwolf
description: It's trained to survive the harsh climate of Frostfire Ridge, so it snuggles as if its life depended on it.

name: Swift Frostwolf
description: Amidst the cold heights of Frostfire, the frostwolves hunt anything they can catch. The fastest among them eat well.

name: Ironside Warwolf
description: It has an armored spike on its tail. Scratch its belly at your own risk.

name: Beastlord's Warwolf
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, it was raised in a crucible of molten fire and shows no fear.

name: Garn Steelmaw
description: A trainer once tried to put decorative metal in his steelmaw wolf's mouth. He had to wait three days to get it back.

name: Summer Wilderling
description: Stubborn and rebellious, this wilderling is loyal to very few. But those few are bonded for life.

name: Ardenweald Wilderling
description: As anima flows to the distant wealds of Ardenweald once more, the wilderlings awaken and cautiously emerge from their canopy burrows.

name: Winter Wilderling
description: Wilderlings serve as support units in battle, preserving their allies and rendering enemy magics useless.

name: Autumnal Wilderling
description: The wilderlings are benevolent, magical creatures of Ardenweald, and are drawn to souls that are strong and pure.

name: Crusader's Direhorn
description: A loyal steed to the holy crusaders of Zandalar.

name: Darkmoon Dirigible
